qas.question: Zbigniew Brzezinski and Malik Mohan consider what country to be a great power too?
Many academics debate the status of this country as a power?
Is there agreement on the status of all powers?
Who have recently recognized contemporary great powers?

plausible_answers.text: a number of academics believe that India is emerging as a great power, while some believe that India remains a middle power.

qas.question: What have observers long considered about India's status?
What do academics believe contemporary great powers remain?

plausible_answers.text: there is no collective agreement among observers as to the status of India

qas.question: What is the consensus about India's status among great powers?

plausible_answers.text: some believe that India remains a middle power

qas.question: What is one type of power some world powers view as India's status in the world?

context: In addition to those contemporary great powers mentioned above, <b3_0>Zbigniew Brzezinski and Malik Mohan<b3_0/> consider <a0_0>India<a0_0/> to be a great power too. Although unlike the contemporary great powers who have long been considered so, <a1_0>India<a1_0/>'s recognition among authorities as a great power is comparatively recent. However, <b6_0>there is <a2_0>no collective agreement<a2_0/> among observers as to the status of India<b6_0/>, for example, <b4_0>a number of academics believe that India is emerging as a great power, while <b7_0>some believe that India remains <b5_0>a middle power<b7_0/><b5_0/>.
